results.title: North India
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Experience Northern India with another ‘Lonely Planet’ travelling video. Climb an elephant’s trunk, learn yoga at an ashram, float along the sacred River Ganges, take a rickshaw to the Taj Mahal and spin prayer wheels in a Buddhist gompa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.

results.title: The Castaway cowboy
results.creator_credit: Vincent McEveety, Winston Hibler, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Disney family film about a shipwrecked cowboy, Lincoln Costain (James Garner) on a Hawaiian island, and his adventures with widow Henrietta MacAvoy (Vera Miles) and land baron Bryson (Robert Culp). Henrietta has a struggling potato farm and through the aid of Lincoln, the farm is eventually turned into a successful cattle ranch. Bryson, who holds Henrietta’s mortgage, wants her land and is prepared to go to any length to get it. On confronting this predicament Lincoln has to decide whether to stay and fight for Henrietta or return to his home in Texas. Cast includes Eric Shea, Elizabeth Smith, Manu Tupou.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent McEveety, Winston Hibler, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Stephen Lennhoff, Phil Frank and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Hosted by Justine Shapiro, this Lonely Planet video explores the subterranean tunnels once inhabited by the Vietcong, takes part in new years celebrations with fireworks heralding the arrival of a new year, takes alternative medicine- drinking snake juice to ward off sickness, and riding the Reunification express.

results.title: The Cars that ate Paris. The Plumber [DVD]
results.brief_description: The Plumber: There is an unexpected knock on the door and Jilly (Judy Morris) an anthropologist, opens it to a strange man who says he is the plumber (Ivor Kants). Weir deftly crafts a tense thriller, as the man is not all he seems and Jilly is tormented by the man’s presence and mind games over the next five days as he totally disrupts her life. Her husband, a university doctor (Robert Coleby), seems oblivious to her anguish and just wants the shower fixed. Disturbing and unsettling in mood, set in a high-rise apartment block with large balconies that feel lifeless and unconducive to a happy life, Jilly plots to play the plumber at his own game and foils his plans. Written and directed by Peter Weir. Production company: SAFC/Channel 9/AFC, copyright by Salt Pan Films 1978/2004, produced by Matt Carroll. Also available on VHS [301733]. The Cars that ate Paris: Peter Weir’s directorial feature film debut is an offbeat horror story/fantasy about a small Australian country town called Paris. Giving the term ‘road kill’ a whole new meaning, the townsfolk of Paris make a living out of the victims of road accidents by allowing a crazy psychiatrist to conduct experiments on them. They also prosper from the cars that cause the accidents but death, destruction and mayhem ensue as the cars turn against the town. John Meillon is wonderful as the chipper Town Mayor and Terry Camilleri portrays the disbelief in his character’s predicament very well. Production Company was AFDC and Royce Smeal Film Productions with copyright by Salt Pan Films 1974/2001. Produced by Hal and Jim McElroy and written and directed by Peter Weir. Cast includes: Chris Haywood, Bruce Spence, Kevin Miles, Max Gillies, Melissa Jaffer, Max Phipps. Released on DVD by ScreenSound Australia. Also available on VHS [016312].

results.title: Turkey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Visitors have long been attracted to Turkey with its unique convergence of three very different worlds - Europe, Asia, and the Middle East. Traveller Justine Shapiro makes her way from the Roman ruins of Ephesus along the Turqoise coast, and then north through the rural Turkish interior to the mountainous Black Sea region.

results.title: The Cellist
results.brief_description: On the plane, returning to Australia from England, Guy meets Les who is on his way home from a Grand Prix motor race. Guy tells Les he is a cellist with the London Philharmonic Orchestra…but Guy is not all he seems. Cast features John Clayton and Rhys McConnochie and a cameo appearance by James Morrison. Winner of the AFI awards for best short fiction film and best director in 1985. Original format 16 mm
results.description: On the plane, returning to Australia from England, Guy meets Les who is on his way home from a Grand Prix motor race. Guy tells Les he is a cellist with the London Philharmonic Orchestra…but Guy is not all he seems. Cast features John Clayton and Rhys McConnochie and a cameo appearance by James Morrison. Winner of the AFI awards for best short fiction film and best director in 1985. Original format 16 mm

results.title: The Cars in your life
results.creator_credit: Terence Macartney-Filgate, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A light, humorous look at the motor car and the great North American itch for a place on the road. From the comparative peace of Honest Joe’s used-car lot, this film hurries you onto our public speedways, where hot rubber erases any distance between all points. Slow-motion and pop-on-pop photography make this a provocative, revealing study of motormania unlimited.

results.title: The Celluloid heroes: 1896-1996 Celebrating 100 years of Australian Cinema. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Robert Francis, Anthony Buckley, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Episode 1: The Pioneers. 1894-1927. Australians of the 1890’s were among the first to discover the film medium, producing a dynamic band of film-makers with a bold and uncompromising vision. Raymond Longford, Lottie Lyall and Beau Smith fought against incredible odds and produced classics like “The Story of the Kelly Gang”, “Robbery under Arms”, “The Squatters Daughter” and the internationally acclaimed “The Sentimental Bloke.” Episode 2: “O.K. for Sound” 1928-1948. The new technology of talking pictures revolutionised the film industry and created new stars. “In the Wake of the Bounty” introduced Errol Flynn. This was the era of the Dad and Dave films and masterpieces such as Charles Chauvel’s “Forty Thousand Horseman.” Australia’s documentary tradition continued with classics like “Journey of a Nation” and “Kokoda Front Line.” Narrated by Bryan Brown.
results.title_for_label: The Celluloid heroes: 1896-1996 Celebrating 100 years of Australian Cinema. - Vol. 1.

This was the era of the Dad and Dave films and masterpieces such as Charles Chauvel’s “Forty Thousand Horseman.” Australia’s documentary tradition continued with classics like “Journey of a Nation” and “Kokoda Front Line.” Narrated by Bryan Brown.
